sentences.en: And then in a flash , Robert F . Kennedy announced his candidacy.
sentences.cn: 然后罗伯特·肯尼迪立刻宣布竞选.

sentences.en: At long last he threw his hat into the ring by announcing his candidacy for mayor.
sentences.cn: 他终于宣布参加市长竞选.

sentences.en: George Bush trounced Mr McCain in South Carolina, ending his candidacy.
sentences.cn: 结果由于这次事件,麦凯恩惨败给布什,饮恨南卡罗来纳州而无缘入主白宫.

sentences.en: I should appreciate it very much if you would consider her candidacy favorably.
sentences.cn: 如果贵校鉴于她的情况给予优先考虑,我将不胜感激.

sentences.en: Mr Blair's candidacy has been badly damaged.
sentences.cn: 布莱尔的候选人形象已经遭到严重破坏.

sentences.en: One or both MDC factions could team up with him; both have welcomed his candidacy.
sentences.cn: MDC内讧的一方或双方都可和他合作, 双方都欢迎他作为候选人.
后来她放弃了她的候选人资格。

sentences.en: They even had clips of Nixon announcing his candidacy.
sentences.cn: 新闻中还配有尼克松宣布竞选的录音剪辑.

sentences.en: Today he is formally announcing his candidacy for President.
sentences.cn: 今天他将正式宣布参加总统竞选。

words.tran_cn: [法] 候选人资格；候选人的地位（等于candidacy）

trans.tran_en: the position of being one of the people who are competing in an election
